questions.question: What is the definition of a close up shot?

choices.answer: A picture in a film that shows a lot of detail.
A shot taken at a medium distance.
Where the camera is distant from the object.
A photograph or film sequence taken from below the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Long Shot?

choices.answer: A shot taken by a camera on a moving object.
Move or cause to move into a sloping position.
A shot where the camera is distant from the object.
A shot taken at a medium distance.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Mid shot?

choices.answer: Usually the first shot of a new scene.
A shot taken at a medium distance.
The camera looks down on the subject from a high angle.
A photograph or film sequence taken from below the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Establishing Shot?

choices.answer: A shot taken at a medium distance.
Arrangement of scenery. On the stage of a pure production.
The camera looks down on the subject from a high angle.
Usually the first shot of a new scene.

questions.question: What is the definition of a High angle shot?

choices.answer: The camera looks down on the subject from a high angle.
An elevated view of an object from above.
The shot is so tight that only a detail of the shot is seen.
Apparent distance from which the camera records the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Low Angle Shot?

choices.answer: Move or cause to move into a sloping position.
A shot taken at a medium distance.
A shot where the camera is distant from the object.
A photograph or film sequence taken from below the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Birds eye view?

choices.answer: The shot is so tight that only a detail in the shot is seen.
Apparent distance from which the camera records the subject.
An elevated view of an object from above.

questions.question: What is the definition of an Extreme close up?

choices.answer: The shot is so tight that only a detail in the shot is seen.
Apparent distance from which the camera records the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of an Eye level shot?

choices.answer: An elevated view of an object from above.
Apparent distance from which the camera records the subject.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Mise-en-scene?

choices.answer: Arrangement of scenery, on the stage of the set of a film.
A scene in a film can't be reached through usual techniques.

questions.question: What is the definition of Special Fx?

choices.answer: Arrangement of scenery, on the stage on the set of a film.
A scene in a film can't be reached through usual techniques.

questions.question: What is the definition of Diegetic Sound?

choices.answer: Used to name the story depicted on screen.
Sound thats origin shows no visibility on screen.

questions.question: What is the definition of Non-diegetic Sound?

choices.answer: Sound thats origin shows no visibility on screen.
Used to name the story depicted on screen.

questions.question: What is the definition of Artificial lighting?

choices.answer: Created by human beings rather than occurring naturally.
Not created by a person but is a natural source of light.

questions.question: What i the definition of Non-Artificial lighting?

choices.answer: Created by human beings rather than occurring naturally.
Not created by a person but is a natural source of light.

questions.question: What is the definition of Panning?

choices.answer: Swivelling a video camera horizontally from a fixed position
Move or cause to move into a sloping position.
A shot taken by a camera on a moving jib.

questions.question: What is the definition of Tilt?

choices.answer: The camera moves alongside the object(s) it is recording.
A camera on a cart that moves on tracks for a smooth motion.
Move or cause to move into a sloping position.

questions.question: What is the definition of tracking?

choices.answer: Where the camera moves alongside the object it is recording.
A wheeled cart or similar device used in filmmaking.

questions.question: What is the definition of zoom?

choices.answer: A wheeled cart or similar device used in filmmaking.
A camera on a cart that moves on tracks for a smooth motion.

questions.question: What is the definition of Dolly?

choices.answer: A wheeled cart or similar device used in filmmaking.
A shot taken by a camera on a moving jib.

questions.question: What is the definition of a Crane shot?

choices.answer: A shot taken by a camera on a moving jib.
A wheeled cart or similar device used in filmmaking.
